segment.source: You can use two different tools to build a customized mobile image (FFU image) in Windows 10:
segment.target: You can use two different tools to build a customized mobile image (FFU image) in Windows 10:

segment.source: Build a mobile image using ImgGen
segment.target: Build a mobile image using ImgGen

segment.source: Build a mobile image using ImgGen
segment.target: Build a mobile image using ImgGen

segment.source: You can use two different tools to build a customized mobile image (FFU image) in Windows 10:
segment.target: You can use two different tools to build a customized mobile image (FFU image) in Windows 10:

segment.source: Using ImgGen.cmd, which is a command file that runs the classic imaging tool, ImageApp.exe.
segment.target: Using ImgGen.cmd, which is a command file that runs the classic imaging tool, ImageApp.exe.

segment.source: This tool was also available earlier releases of Windows 10 Mobile including Windows Phone 8.1 and the various GDRs.
segment.target: This tool was also available earlier releases of Windows 10 Mobile including Windows Phone 8.1 and the various GDRs.

segment.source: Using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) command-line interface, which is new for Windows 10.
segment.target: Using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) command-line interface, which is new for Windows 10.

segment.source: In this walkthrough, we'll show how to use ImgGen.cmd to build the custom mobile image.
segment.target: In this walkthrough, we'll show how to use ImgGen.cmd to build the custom mobile image.

segment.source: In another walkthrough, we'll go through how to create another mobile image that includes the customizations we've done so far in addition to other customizations available only through Windows Provisioning by using the Windows ICD CLI.
segment.target: In another walkthrough, we'll go through how to create another mobile image that includes the customizations we've done so far in addition to other customizations available only through Windows Provisioning by using the Windows ICD CLI.

segment.source: To build a customized image using ImgGen
segment.target: To build a customized image using ImgGen

segment.source: Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS2015 window as an administrator.
segment.target: Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS2015 window as an administrator.

segment.source: If you are running Windows 8.1, complete the following steps to set the USN journal registry size to 1 Mb on your development PC.
segment.target: If you are running Windows 8.1, complete the following steps to set the USN journal registry size to 1 Mb on your development PC.

segment.source: Otherwise, skip to the next step.
segment.target: Otherwise, skip to the next step.

segment.source: Change the USN minimum size registry key by running the following command:
segment.target: Change the USN minimum size registry key by running the following command:

segment.source: reg add HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlFileSystem /v NtfsAllowUsnMinSize1Mb /t REGDWORD /d 1
segment.target: reg add HKEYLOCALMACHINESYSTEMCurrentControlSetControlFileSystem /v NtfsAllowUsnMinSize1Mb /t REGDWORD /d 1

segment.source: Reboot the PC before proceeding to the next step.
segment.target: Reboot the PC before proceeding to the next step.

segment.source: Run ImgGen.cmd by using the following command.
segment.target: Run ImgGen.cmd by using the following command.

segment.source: This command will build an image that will be called TestFlash.ffu.
segment.target: This command will build an image that will be called TestFlash.ffu.

segment.source: Note This command assumes you've gone through the rest of the walkthroughs in this section.
segment.target: Note This command assumes you've gone through the rest of the walkthroughs in this section.

segment.source: For more information about the command-line syntax for ImgGen.cmd, see Using ImgGen.cmd to generate the image in Build a mobile image using ImgGen.cmd.
segment.target: For more information about the command-line syntax for ImgGen.cmd, see Using ImgGen.cmd to generate the image in Build a mobile image using ImgGen.cmd.

segment.source: Once the image is built, you'll need to sign it so it can be flashed to a mobile device.
segment.target: Once the image is built, you'll need to sign it so it can be flashed to a mobile device.
